[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex sentence structures may impede immediate clarity (e.g., "It is the street of greatest importance to every Chinese girl. On it will be bought her dowry jewels.")
[LEXICON]: Some archaic or less common vocabulary (e.g., "thou", "thee" not present but "passively quiet", "lend light" might confuse some readers)

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from the jewel selection scene to Kuei Ping's memory of the mission school (could benefit from a smoother transition)
[STRUCTURE]: The narrative jumps between descriptive scenes and character introspection without clear sectioning or transitions

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex sentence structures may impede immediate clarity (e.g., "For at the spring holidays...").
[LEXICON]: Some word choices feel slightly formal or less common in modern writing (e.g., "squandered your valuable time", "bowed out").

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from Kuei Ping's memories to the present with Madame Yen (could benefit from a smoother transition).
[CLARITY]: The conflict's emotional depth is clear, but the swift decision-making process feels somewhat rushed.
